required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of Electrical Acupuncture Stimulation Therapy for Postprostatectomy Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: The Study of Electrical Acupuncture Stimulation Therapy for Postprostatectomy Incontinence

lead_sponsor.agency: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

clinical_study.source: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School

brief_summary.textblock: More than 50% patients underwent prostatectomy suffered from postoperative incontinence, and the effect of pelvic floor muscle training is very limited. Electrical acupuncture stimulation therapy has been demonstrated to work on other kinds of Urinary Incontinence. Before this trial, the researchers have conducted pre-experiments where electrical acupuncture stimulation therapy was conducted for few postprostatectomy Incontinence patients. On the basis of the preliminary work, this prospective, random control research aims to verify the safety and effectiveness of electroacupuncture in the treatment of postprostatectomy Incontinence.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: change of urine pad quantity for 24 hours after 6 courses compared with baseline
change of weight in kilograms of urine pad for 24 hours after 6 courses compared with baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: change of urine pad quantity for 24 hours after 4 courses compared with baseline
change of weight in kilograms of urine pad for 24 hours after 6 courses compared with baseline
changes of The expanded prostate cancer index composite(EPIC) score after 4-6 courses compared with baseline

intervention.description: Participants received acupuncture at bilateral Baliao. After skin disinfection, sterile adhesive pads were placed on bilateral Baliao, and acupuncture needles were inserted through the adhesive pads. Following needle insertion, small, equal manipulations of twirling, lifting, and thrusting were performed on all needles to reach de qi. Electrodes from the electroacupuncture apparatus were attached transversely to the needle handles. The electroacupuncture stimulation lasted for 30 minutes with a continuous wave of 2-15 Hz. Participants received 3 treatment sessions per week (ideally every other day) for 6 consecutive weeks, 18 sessions in total.

Participants received sham acupuncture at locations one inch besides bilateral Baliao without needle insertion. Electrodes from the electroacupuncture apparatus were attached transversely to the needle handles. The electroacupuncture stimulation lasted for 30 minutes with a continuous wave of 2-15 Hz. Participants received 3 treatment sessions per week (ideally every other day) for 6 consecutive weeks, 18 sessions in total.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- localized prostate cancer (stage: cT1-cT2, N0, M0)
- 4-6weeks after prostatectomy
- postprostatectomy prostate specific antigen (PSA) test below cured level
- incontinence one month after surgery
- ECOG score:0-1
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of neoadjuvant hormonal therapy
- history of transurethral resection of the prostate (TUPR)
- history of operation on pelvis
- history of incontinence before prostatectomy

facility.name: The Affiliated Nanjing Drum Tower Hospital of Nanjing University Medical School
